1_14tJBPnxcrF9kMK5v7DULWnaJx3JepirXb.body:
For anyone wondering, the font seems to be called 'GlassTTYVT220'. I've never seen a TTY using a font like this (niether in Arch Linux nor Ubuntu, at least), but that's probably because it's meant to emulate older displays anyway. I think this is an example of [Skeuomorphism](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skeuomorph).

Edit: the last word in the above paragraph is supposed to be a link to a Wikipedia page--but for me, it has the same style as plain text. Does it look like that to anyone else?

> [nippletwister](#comment_10_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf): Yes it does. This is the same link from me.UPD: Yes. it seems that this site is old, so there are some bugs still which are deleted in new versions of ZeroTalk-like sites.

Huh. Mystery solved, then.

> [yeti](#comment_1_14tJBPnxcrF9kMK5v7DULWnaJx3JepirXb): 
> ...but it doesn't scale well due to aliasing problems, so probably I'll switch to https://github.com/chrissimpkins/Hack or some other newer monospaced font soon.

Ooh, Hack is nice. Maybe consider **[Fantasque Sans](http://openfontlibrary.org/en/font/fantasque-sans-mono)** [<-- link] too.

1_1BgmUwuLD8DU6ffpaKSCGjZDDddEoivdLY.body: Currently, webtorrents are not compatible with conventional torrents. You can't share items from one ecosystem on the other without some kind of bridge (which is frowned upon in decentralized systems), so this would take some kludging around to accomplish.

7_1BDapygZHNG8GxEuSsEpK9Xipm9mFfW1F2.body: I don't think the available timeout will allow 3 Gig's worth of stuff to transfer smoothly, if at all. You might want to make the files optional.

After poking around in [**this**](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Gif7PqWTzVWDQ42Mo7np3zXmGAo3DXc7h/) site's content.json, it seems that you need to put them in your content file's `"files_optional": {...}` section.
There's more on the Github page [**here**](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/163).
